alert.note: Alert for Hunterdon; Mercer; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 6:02AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hunterdon, northwestern Mercer, southwestern Somerset and east central Bucks Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 602 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near New Hope, or 10 miles northwest of Trenton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ewing, Pennington, New Hope, Hopewell, Washington Crossing, Skillman, Cloverhill, Flagtown, Belle Mead, Lambertville and Newtown Grant. This includes Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 74 and 76. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
